name: Movie Doctors and Lawyers Quiz | Classic Movies | 10 Questions

questions.text: 'Anatomy of A Murder' had an interesting cast which included Lee Remick, Ben Gazzara and George C Scott. What actor had the lead role as a defense attorney?
questions.explanation:
James Stewart.

	Phyllis Diller once referred to herself as 'the murder of an anatomy'. Nice play on words.

questions.text: 'Witness for the Prosecution', based on the Agatha Christie short story, also had an interesting cast: it included Marlene Dietrich and Tyrone Power. Again, who had the lead as the defense attorney?
'The Magnificent Obsession' featured this actor as a playboy-turned-doctor
'Sergeant Rutledge' featured a trial in the Old West in the military context of a court martial. The defense attorney was played by:
questions.explanation:
Jeffrey Hunter.

	John Ford, I believe. Not so good.

questions.text: 'Inherit the Wind' featured Spencer Tracy in one of his best roles. Who played the opposing attorney?
'The Snake Pit' was an early look at the problems of psychiatry and mental illness. Who played the troubled patient?
questions.explanation:
Olivia DeHavilland.

	An oldie but a goodie

questions.text: 'And Justice For All' provided a more recent look at the legal system. Who played the lead role of the crusading attorney?
'Judgment at Nuremberg' was another courtroom movie with Spencer Tracy - this time as a judge. Who played the prosecuting attorney?
'Three Faces of Eve' was another look at the world of abnormal psychology. Who played Eve?
questions.explanation:
Joanne Woodward.

	It was a big role for her
